verses.kjv: In the seventh month, in the one and twentieth day of the month, came the word of the LORD by the prophet Haggai, saying,
verses.web: In the seventh month, in the twenty-first day of the month, LORD’s word came by Haggai the prophet, saying,
verses.ct: On the 21st day of the 7th month, the LORD spoke through the prophet Haggai:

verses.kjv: Speak now to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the son of Josedech, the high priest, and to the residue of the people, saying,
verses.web: “Speak now to Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua, the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and to the remnant of the people, saying,
verses.ct: "Go speak to Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, the governor of Judah, and to Joshua son of Josedech, the high priest, and to the rest of the people. Tell them this:

verses.kjv: Who is left among you that saw this house in her first glory? and how do ye see it now? is it not in your eyes in comparison of it as nothing?
verses.web: ‘Who is left among you who saw this house in its former glory? How do you see it now? Isn’t it in your eyes as nothing?
verses.ct: 'Is anyone still alive among you who remembers this temple in its original glory? Look at it now — compared to what it was, doesn't it seem like nothing?'

verses.kjv: Yet now be strong, O Zerubbabel, saith the LORD; and be strong, O Joshua, son of Josedech, the high priest; and be strong, all ye people of the land, saith the LORD, and work: for I am with you, saith the LORD of hosts:
verses.web: Yet now be strong, Zerubbabel,’ says LORD. ‘Be strong, Joshua, son of Jehozadak, the high priest. Be strong, all you people of the land,’ says LORD, ‘and work, for I am with you,’ says LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: "But take courage, Zerubbabel," says the LORD. "Take courage, Joshua son of Josedech, high priest. Take courage, all you people of the land," says the LORD. "Get to work, because I am with you," declares the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: According to the word that I covenanted with you when ye came out of Egypt, so my spirit remaineth among you: fear ye not.
verses.web: This is the word that I covenanted with you when you came out of Egypt, and my Spirit lived among you. ‘Don’t be afraid.’
verses.ct: "This is the promise I made to you when you came out of Egypt, and my spirit remains among you. Don't be afraid."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD of hosts; Yet once, it is a little while, and I will shake the heavens, and the earth, and the sea, and the dry land;
verses.web: For this is what LORD of Armies says: ‘Yet once, it is a little while, and I will shake the heavens, the earth, the sea, and the dry land;
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says this: "In just a little while, I will shake the heavens and the earth, the sea and the dry land.

verses.kjv: And I will shake all nations, and the desire of all nations shall come: and I will fill this house with glory, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: and I will shake all nations. The precious things of all nations will come, and I will fill this house with glory, says LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: I will shake every nation, and the treasures of all nations will pour in. I will fill this temple with glory," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: The silver is mine, and the gold is mine, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: The silver is mine, and the gold is mine,’ says LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: "All the silver is mine, and all the gold is mine," declares the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: The glory of this latter house shall be greater than of the former, saith the LORD of hosts: and in this place will I give peace, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: ‘The latter glory of this house will be greater than the former,’ says LORD of Armies; ‘and in this place I will give peace,’ says LORD of Armies.”
verses.ct: "The glory of this new temple will surpass the glory of the first one," says the LORD of hosts. "And in this place I will give peace," declares the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: In the four and twentieth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, came the word of the LORD by Haggai the prophet, saying,
verses.web: In the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, LORD’s word came by Haggai the prophet, saying,
verses.ct: On the 24th day of the 9th month, during the 2nd year of King Darius, the LORD spoke through the prophet Haggai:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Ask now the priests concerning the law, saying,
verses.web: “LORD of Armies says: Ask now the priests concerning the law, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says: "Ask the priests to rule on this question of the law:

verses.kjv: If one bear holy flesh in the skirt of his garment, and with his skirt do touch bread, or pottage, or wine, or oil, or any meat, shall it be holy? And the priests answered and said, No.
verses.web: ‘If someone carries holy meat in the fold of his garment, and with his fold touches bread, stew, wine, oil, or any food, will it become holy?’ ” The priests answered, “No.”
verses.ct: If someone is carrying consecrated meat in the fold of his garment, and that fold touches bread, stew, wine, oil, or any other food, does that food become holy?" The priests answered, "No."

verses.kjv: Then said Haggai, If one that is unclean by a dead body touch any of these, shall it be unclean? And the priests answered and said, It shall be unclean.
verses.web: Then Haggai said, “If one who is unclean by reason of a dead body touch any of these, will it be unclean?” The priests answered, “It will be unclean.”
verses.ct: Then Haggai asked, "What if someone who has become unclean by touching a dead body then touches any of these things — does it become unclean?" The priests answered, "Yes, it becomes unclean."

verses.kjv: Then answered Haggai, and said, So is this people, and so is this nation before me, saith the LORD; and so is every work of their hands; and that which they offer there is unclean.
verses.web: Then Haggai answered, “ ‘So is this people, and so is this nation before me,’ says LORD; ‘and so is every work of their hands. That which they offer there is unclean.
verses.ct: Haggai responded, "That's exactly how it is with this people and this nation before me," says the LORD. "Everything they do and everything they offer here is unclean."

verses.kjv: And now, I pray you, consider from this day and upward, from before a stone was laid upon a stone in the temple of the LORD:
verses.web: Now, please consider from this day and backward, before a stone was laid on a stone in LORD’s temple.
verses.ct: "Now think carefully about what life was like before this day — before a single stone was placed on another in the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: Since those days were, when one came to an heap of twenty measures, there were but ten: when one came to the pressfat for to draw out fifty vessels out of the press, there were but twenty.
verses.web: Through all that time, when one came to a heap of twenty measures, there were only ten. When one came to the wine vat to draw out fifty, there were only twenty.
verses.ct: Back then, when someone went to a grain pile expecting 20 measures, there were only 10. When someone went to the wine vat expecting to draw out 50 measures, there were only 20.

verses.kjv: I smote you with blasting and with mildew and with hail in all the labours of your hands; yet ye turned not to me, saith the LORD.
verses.web: I struck you with blight, mildew, and hail in all the work of your hands; yet you didn’t turn to me,’ says LORD.
verses.ct: I struck your crops with blight, mildew, and hail — everything your hands worked for. Yet still you didn't turn back to me," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Consider now from this day and upward, from the four and twentieth day of the ninth month, even from the day that the foundation of the LORD’s temple was laid, consider it.
verses.web: ‘Consider, please, from this day and backward, from the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, since the day that the foundation of LORD’s temple was laid, consider it.
verses.ct: "Think carefully about what happens from this day forward — from this 24th day of the 9th month, the very day the foundation of the LORD's temple was laid. Pay attention to this:

verses.kjv: Is the seed yet in the barn? yea, as yet the vine, and the fig tree, and the pomegranate, and the olive tree, hath not brought forth: from this day will I bless you.
verses.web: Is the seed yet in the barn? Yes, the vine, the fig tree, the pomegranate, and the olive tree haven’t produced. From today I will bless you.’ ”
verses.ct: Is there still no grain in the storehouse? Have the grapevine, the fig tree, the pomegranate, and the olive tree failed to produce? From this day on, I will bless you."

verses.kjv: And again the word of the LORD came unto Haggai in the four and twentieth day of the month, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came the second time to Haggai in the twenty-fourth day of the month, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Haggai a second time on the 24th day of that month:

verses.kjv: Speak to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, saying, I will shake the heavens and the earth;
verses.web: “Speak to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, saying, ‘I will shake the heavens and the earth.
verses.ct: "Tell Zerubbabel, governor of Judah: I am about to shake the heavens and the earth.

verses.kjv: And I will overthrow the throne of kingdoms, and I will destroy the strength of the kingdoms of the heathen; and I will overthrow the chariots, and those that ride in them; and the horses and their riders shall come down, every one by the sword of his brother.
verses.web: I will overthrow the throne of kingdoms. I will destroy the strength of the kingdoms of the nations. I will overthrow the chariots, and those who ride in them. The horses and their riders will come down, everyone by the sword of his brother.
verses.ct: I will topple the thrones of kingdoms and shatter the power of foreign nations. I will overturn chariots and their drivers. Horses will fall and their riders with them, as they turn their swords on each other.

verses.kjv: In that day, saith the LORD of hosts, will I take thee, O Zerubbabel, my servant, the son of Shealtiel, saith the LORD, and will make thee as a signet: for I have chosen thee, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: In that day, says LORD of Armies, I will take you, Zerubbabel, my servant, the son of Shealtiel,’ says LORD, ‘and will make you as a signet, for I have chosen you,’ says LORD of Armies.”
verses.ct: On that day," declares the LORD of hosts, "I will take you, Zerubbabel my servant, son of Shealtiel," says the LORD, "and I will make you like a signet ring — because I have chosen you," declares the LORD of hosts.
